intro: Otocarpum, commonly known as the tropical shrub or tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, often yellow or white flowers. The fruit is typically a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Otocarpum species are native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. They are often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and wetlands.
